title: How to Remove Melted Plastic from a Frying Pan

steps.title: Place the frying pan with the melted plastic in a freezer.
steps.content: Place the frying pan with the melted plastic in a freezer. Leave it to chill for at least a couple of hours so that when you take out the pan, the plastic must have hardened.

steps.title: Meanwhile, find a non-marring object like a piece of wood, plastic mallet etc.
steps.content: Meanwhile, find a non-marring object like a piece of wood, plastic mallet etc. You can use anything with some heft, but it should be softer than the metal of the frying pan.

steps.title: Remove the super-cooled frying pan from the freezer.
steps.content: Remove the super-cooled frying pan from the freezer. Make sure the plastic has hardened.

steps.title: Place the frying pan on a flat surface, with the bottom side turned up.
steps.content: Place the frying pan on a flat surface, with the bottom side turned up. Its better to do this job on floor that kitchen shelves. Whatever surface it is, it should be able to withstand a great amount of force.

steps.title: Using the striking tool, gently tap the bottom of the frying pan in the area where the plastic is pooled.
steps.content: Using the striking tool, gently tap the bottom of the frying pan in the area where the plastic is pooled. Do not tap too hard. It can cause damage to the pan.

steps.title: If this fails, repeat step 5, but not quite as gently.
steps.content: If this fails, repeat step 5, but not quite as gently. Be patient with this job. Gradually the plastic will separate from the pan. Once it is removed, wash the pan before any use.
